name: places/ChIJq6r-BAT2wokRQLRWMelp0VQ
formattedAddress: 168 E 107th St, New York, NY 10029, USA
adrFormatAddress: 168 E 107th St, New York, NY 10029-3953, USA

originalText.text:
It is difficult to give this place even 1 star, it deserves nothing.  There is no recovery here, no life skills, no encouragement.  It is nothing more than a prison, giving such bad care the only way one can actually survive is by living for an act of revenge.  The director is drop dead mean, with little to no life skills.  There is a Miss C... a laughable "counselor" that especially needs to be avoided.  The woman has questionable acredation, whose entire counseling approach is nothing more a cruel focus on rules minus any ethics to actually do something worthwhile.

There is some redemption here in a streetwise house manager nicknamed "Smiley" who seems sincere in her want to actually be of help, but in this horror show she has a real uphill battle.

originalText.text: I can only share my experiences from me being a graduate of Able House... I have great memories there with others like John Crosby, Denice Rutledge, Tammie Appleton ... The problem is that it's hard to find other graduates from there... If you know me look me up on FB

originalText.text: This place is horrible aot of favoritism the director is a mean person they will throw you out for missing an appointment and they throw you out on the streets; i really thought i was doing a good job but i guess not
